programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Alien Fury: Countdown to Invasion (2000)
programme.desc: A secret government agency hatches a plot to fake an imminent alien invasion so the president can justify the launching of a satellite weapon. But it soon emerges that there really is an armada poised to attack the Earth if the device is launched. Sci-fi thriller, starring Dale Midkiff and Stephen Tobolowsky

programme.title: Legend Lowdown

programme.title: Jet Stream (2012)
programme.desc: A TV weatherman tries to prove his theory that a number of unexplained catastrophes are the result of powerful winds found in the upper atmosphere coming down to ground level. His claims attract the attention of government scientists, who need his help to control the phenomena before it destroys all life on Earth. Disaster movie, starring David Chokachi, Don Michael Paul and Preston James Hillier

programme.title: Legend Lowdown

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew angers an advanced alien race called the Metrons whose justice system is based on physical combat, and Captain Kirk soon finds himself on an uninhabited asteroid fighting for his life against a lizard-like creature. William Shatner stars

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The crew is afflicted by peculiar symptoms while mapping an extremely dense globular cluster and discovers that aliens have been hijacking crew members in their sleep. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Airwolf
programme.desc: The team take on a sinister villain threatening to destroy a freighter containing atomic waste if people with contagious diseases are not isolated from the rest of society. Barry Van Dyke stars

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: A girl's death leads Walker to investigate a factory that may be polluting the town's water supply. Adventure, starring Chuck Norris

Action thriller, starring Lewis Collins, Judy Davis, Edward Woodward, Maurice Roeves and Richard Widmark

programme.title: Desolation (2017)
programme.desc: Joined by her son and her best friend, a woman heads into the remote wilderness to scatter her late husband's ashes, only to discover that they're being stalked by a hiker. Thriller, starring Toby Nichols

programme.title: Feral (2017)
programme.desc: A weekend hike becomes a bloodbath when a group of students are attacked by a wild animal, turning them into rabid, bloodthirsty creatures. Horror, starring Scout Taylor-Compton, Olivia Luccardi and Lew Temple

programme.title: Echoes of Fear (2018)
programme.desc: After inheriting her grandfather's house, a young woman must confront the mystery of his sudden demise and the evil force that lurks inside the abode. Horror, starring Trista Robinson, Hannah Race and Paul Chirico

programme.desc: Picard, Ensign Ro, Keiko and Guinan are transformed into children just as the Ferengi attack, claiming the Enterprise as salvage. Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Mindscape (2013)
programme.desc: A psychic with the ability to explore people's memories uses his talents to aid the police, until a case goes disastrously wrong. Desperate for work, he agrees to help a wealthy couple discover why their teenage daughter is on a hunger strike, but beings to fear she is manipulating her memories to deceive him. Fantasy thriller, starring Mark Strong, Taissa Farmiga and Brian Cox

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers 3 (2017)
programme.desc: A sheriff and his team set out to capture the flesh-eating Creeper on the last day of its 23-day feeding frenzy, and learn more about the creature's dark origins. Horror sequel, starring Stan Shaw, Gabrielle Haugh and Brandon Smith

programme.title: The Brood (1979)
programme.desc: A radical psychiatrist attempts to make a female patient express her pent-up emotions, and at last succeeds _ but isn't prepared for the hideous consequences of his actions. Chiller, written and directed by horror guru David Cronenberg, starring Oliver Reed, Samantha Eggar, Art Hindle and Cindy Hinds

Horror adventure, starring Logan Miller, Kristine Froseth, Jolene Anderson

programme.desc: Billie Piper stars in this dramatisation of Philip Pullman's novel - the second in his quartet of books about Victorian heroine Sally Lockhart. It's six years since the events of The Ruby in the Smoke, and Sally has her own financial consulting business. When a client loses a fortune following the unexpected collapse of a shipping firm, the young businesswoman grows suspicious and sets out to investigate - and a clairvoyant soon puts her on the trail of the richest man in Europe and a terrifying new weapon, the Hopkinson Self-Regulator. Period thriller, co-starring Jared Harris, JJ Feild, David Harewood and Lyndsey Marshal

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: DNA tests on a suspected robber prove his innocence but also reveal his father was an unnamed vagrant strangled on a tube train 15 years earlier. The team reopens the case, going in pursuit of the victim's other family members - including the man they believe to be his brother - while Brian questions the homeless community, only to fall foul of a gang of robbers. Peter Davison and Keith Allen guest star

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: After spending a passion-filled night together, Alex reveals she may cancel the wedding, but Jessica's reaction forces her to think again. Katie struggles to fight her attraction to Sam, and though Trudi discovers the source of her nuisance phone calls, she is left just as confused as ever about her relationship with Richard when Sally arrives with a revelation

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Fresh DNA tests on an unidentified body found in 1996 reveal a family link to a Home Office fingerprint analyst, who has not seen her brother since she was seven, when he brought her over to the UK from their home country of Albania. The victim had been working as a police interpreter - and the motive seems clear when it turns out his last assignment was translating for a witness in a murder trial against a notorious Albanian criminal. Meanwhile, Gerry embarks on a French cookery course, but the language barrier results in a rather surprising date. Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Smother
programme.desc: Jenny tries desperately to resolve her financial difficulties and with her baby due any day now, she is increasingly panicked and angry with Denis for leaving her in such a mess. Anna and Rory sit the boys down to discuss something that will have an impact on everyone, while events spiral out of control at Anna's birthday lunch despite Val's attempts to keep the family together

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Kian is desperate to deliver the surgery that Bea desires, but Jac is too stressed and refuses to help, forcing him to consider what he is willing to sacrifice to give her what she wants. Dom and Lofty are too busy putting others first to deal with their own problems, and Donna distracts herself from her troubles by focussing on a returning patient. But when she goes missing, Donna has to be brave enough to convince them both to face their fears. Guest starring Lorraine Chase (Emmerdale)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.desc: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

Raj offers up a set of stylish and functional stools, while Rachel showcases two charming funfair dolphins. Nigel Havers hosts

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwall's ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway's walk in Cardigan Bay has something for everyone. For the first half he's at one with nature as he explores one of Britain's largest and oldest raised peat bogs. His route then takes him to a unique railway museum, filled with nostalgia and he also discovers the legend of Cantre Gwaelod at Sarn Cynfelyn where the shingle spit stretches an incredible 11kms out to sea. He finishes at the university town of Aberystwyth with its Victorian cliff-top pleasure park, complete with camera obscura. Derek also has a go at paddle-boarding - which has its challenges

The Strictly Come Dancing judge is kept on her toes by the team and from pig farming to pottery, takes it all in her stride

programme.desc: Crews race to rescue a shark attack victim and two boys who have been swept far out to sea

programme.title: University Challenge

programme.desc: Documentary charting the last five years of the life of cancer campaigner Deborah James, a former deputy head teacher who amassed a huge social media following through her online persona Bowelbabe. She talks frankly about her diagnosis with bowel cancer and the treatment she received, revealing what the reality of living with bowel cancer was like for her and those closest to her. The film features mobile-phone footage, Deborah's collection of Tik Tok videos, Instagram posts, You Me and the Big C podcasts, family videos and Deborah's voice notes

Ryan Hand is in Armagh on the hunt for a healthy ready meal and chef Suzie Lee finds a delicious fishy surprise in Lough Neagh.

programme.desc: Team members inspect an oil tanker the size of two football pitches, which must be examined inch by inch before it is allowed to set sail. Meanwhile, a second team is called out to repair a vital piece of equipment on a cargo ferry that is holding up the transport of vital supplies to a nearby island

Trump was a runner-up to Ronnie O'Sullivan last year, but faces a tough opener against the 2020 semi-finalist

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Nina Wadia was brought up near the coast in Hong Kong and has fond recollections of her time by the water, so her stay at the B&B is a chance to reminisce on her favourite memories of the seaside. However, the actress and comedian doesn't get to relax and is put to work bringing in the catch of the day - lobster. All that hard graft can't go to waste, because she's taught by chef Alex how to cook a decadent lobster linguine with wild garlic to celebrate the fresh catch. The next day offers her the opportunity to make chocolate truffles with a local chocolatier

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Jules and Jackie come to the workshop to tell Jay Blades about their 12-year-old son Henry, who saved Jules's life when the pair were on a run in the countryside. Jules collapsed suddenly with a heart attack, and Henry administered CPR and called the emergency services. His quick thinking and calm actions saved his dad's life. Ciaran goes all out for his team's final build, with an aeroplane cabin-style gaming chair, complete with surrounding shelves and even a fridge for Henry. Jay then crosses Bradford to Thorpe Edge, where he meets Angela. She wants to nominate Brenda, who runs a non-profit furniture service that helps local people in need

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: When an experienced hiker fails to return from the top of a mountain on Skye, a multi-agency response involving the police, mountain rescue and the coastguard is launched. In Glencoe, a campervan driver reports his windscreen has been shattered by what he believes to be a bullet, while a drugs warrant in Dingwall exposes a concealed attic containing evidence of a cannabis-growing operation

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from King's Lynn on the north Norfolk coast, with experts Raj Bisram and Stephanie Connell, and pays a visit to the International Aviation Academy in Norwich

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents the programme in which five dealers bid against one another to buy intriguing items brought in by members of the public

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: The first of five walks in Snowdonia is led by 30-year-old mother-of-two Laura, who takes the group on a walk up to Cwm Idwal, the location of Wales' first National Nature Reserve

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls, the day's talking points and interviews on today's news

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the morning session on day five from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Jack Lisowski's first-round match against a qualifier and the start of Kyren Wilson's. Lisowski reached the quarter-finals of this event for the first time last year, while Wilson's best showing was in 2020, when he was runner-up to Ronnie O'Sullivan

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day five from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Judd Trump's first-round match against a qualifier and the start of Mark Selby's match. Selby and Trump claimed victories over Jamie Jones and Hossein Vafaei at this stage last year and will be expecting to progress once again

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Britain's fastest ever sprinter Linford Christie checks in the B&B, hoping to make quick work of the daily tasks. The sporting legend takes a break from his athletics coaching to reflect on his career, as well as embracing the itinerary the B&B team has set him. Among other experiences, he discovers the art of beekeeping and tests the waters off the Causeway Coast, having recently learned to swim

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Two-part programme exploring the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examining the rich culture and troubled past. In the first episode, Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale and his team of tradespeople update a crumbling bothy on the small island of Ulva, which locals want to rent out to visitors. With no power, water or easy access, Banjo has his work cut out, but the help of handyman Tom, painter Lisa, and his husband Ro enable him to embark on his most challenging design brief to date

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues in mid-Wales with visits to a period property near Abergavenny, a Victorian manor house in Aberystwyth and a contemporary conversion outside Cardigan. The judges are led by presenter Owain Wyn Evans, with interior designer Mandy Watkins and architect Glen Thomas, who score the properties out of 10 on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Congenital heart surgeon Osama Jaber must perform lifesaving surgery on 15-day-old baby Callie-Mae, who was born with the two large arteries of her heart, the aorta and the pulmonary, in the wrong positions, meaning her body is not getting enough oxygenated blood. Neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on 30-year-old Sam, who suffers from debilitating headaches, as she was born with a condition where the lower part of the brain pushes down onto her spine, putting pressure on the brainstem and spinal cord

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance is persuaded to try hypnotherapy for an awkward affliction and old enemies are sniffing around as Lance and Andy start finding some decent items

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day five, featuring first-round matches at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a first-round match from day five at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Two years ago, patient Karl sustained a brain injury after falling downstairs, as a result of which surgeons had to leave a portion of his skull missing to stop his brain from swelling. Today, neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew intends to rebuild his skull - but at the moment, a hospital bed cannot be found. Meanwhile, consultant Sheila Fraser removes a tumour believed to be the size of a football from a patient's abdomen and a seven-year-old has metal pins removed from his legs, now his broken limbs have healed

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: An inherited 1950s moped and a hand-cranked butter churn barrel that brings back fond memories are among the items transformed. Sabrina Grant hosts

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the start of Robert Milkins v Joe Perry and the conclusion of Mark Allen v Fan Zhengyi in the first round. Allen set up a plum tie against eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan at this stage last year with a 10-6 victory over Scott Donaldson, and will hope to progress further this time around having won the Northern Ireland Open, UK Championship and World Grand Prix since then

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: Former US president Bill Clinton talks for the first time about his decision to go against the advice of his State Department and grant Gerry Adams a visa, a move which kick-started the peace process. However, the Docklands bombing in 1996 _ followed by the explosion in Manchester four months later _ signalled the end of the ceasefire and saw Sinn Fein banned from the all-party talks

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Work on the derelict miller's cottage appears to be progressing, but Griff Rhys Jones meets opposition from the locals over his plans to renovate the mill. Plus, the comedian takes on another unusual restoration project

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction

programme.title: Own the Sky: Jet Pack Dreamers
programme.desc: The story of Australian David Mayman, whose passion for the tantalising possibilities of jetpacks became an obsession. Filmed over 10 years, the documentary follows his seemingly impossible quest to realise his childhood dream to build and fly the world's first jetpack - an ambition that almost cost him his life

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: John Eliot Gardiner conducts the Monteverdi Choir and the English Baroque Soloists in a performance of Johann Sebastian Bach's celebrated composition St John Passion, from 2008, with Mark Padmore as the Evangelist and Peter Harvey as Christus. Petroc Trelawny presents

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusions of Robert Milkins v Joe Perry and Gary Wilson v Elliot Slessor in the first round. Milkins has been a professional since 1995, but his last appearance in the main draw was in 2018, when he reached the second round. Wilson was a semi-finalist in 2019, but that is the only occasion he has progressed beyond this stage

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day five at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Kyren Wilson v Ryan Day and the start of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui, both in the first round. Wilson, a runner-up in 2020, claimed a hard-fought 10-8 victory over 2016 finalist Ding Junhui at this stage last year, while Murphy suffered a defeat by the same score line at the hands of Stephen Maguire and now faces the player who eliminated him at this stage of the 2021 UK Championship

programme.title: Alex Higgins: The People's Champion
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates a look back at the often controversial life of the two-time world snooker champion, who was widely regarded as one of the most naturally gifted players in the history of his sport, but whose brilliance was flawed by his demons. With contributions by members of his family, as well as fellow snooker greats Jimmy White, Ronnie O'Sullivan, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Mini-series based on the novel by John McGahern, following a man growing old among a family who try to live through tragic circumstances. Moran is an overbearing father who believes himself to be benevolent, but the death of his wife makes his relationship with his five children increasingly difficult. Drama, starring Tony Doyle and Susan Lynch

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Maggie is reunited with Luke in London and meets her first love, while back at Great Meadow, Moran's other daughters confront their futures

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon,an epic 17th-century religious painting exploring temptation and desire. He uncovers some unusual connections with sumo wrestling, Victor Hugo's Les Miserables, and a 17-year-old girl called Madeleine

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl

However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Raj Bisram help two teams look for items at Bath Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles finds out about the history of the humble spoon

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear meets an old friend from university and Jimmi discovers the Beechwalk is being sold. New midwife Malika struggles with a young couple who have just given birth

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bristol to help family members struggling to find space for all their bikes. The unusual layout of their front room needs some clever thinking to maximise the space and storage

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a Kent family find a new home in the East Riding of Yorkshire with room for a catering business, and takes a trip on a traditional fishing boat in Bridlington

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more people bring their items to the dealers to sell. First in is Billy with a large two-seater spaceship from the funfair, followed by Nyree with a French decanter she found in a charity shop. Next in is Lee with a 1970s pay phone in original and working condition and Kevin with a Hornby train set he has owned for 60 years. Finally, Carole enters hoping luck is on her side as she tries to sell her tombola machine

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Rose Matafeo

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Ulster Unionist Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Calls, the day's talking points and interviews on today's news

programme.title: Port Pàipeir
programme.desc: Norman comes back to Paper Port to seize Matilda's powers. Once he owns them, nobody will be able to stop him from conquering the world - with a chain of fast-food restaurants

programme.title: A' Chuil
programme.desc: Choirstaidh takes a look at the famous artist Hilma Af Klint, and shows you how to make your own picture in her style

programme.title: Alba Eagalach

programme.desc: With help from Professor Calcalas, Tintin, Dìleas and Caiptean Adag go on an expedition to find Rackham Dheirg’s treasure

programme.title: Dealbhan Fraoich (Heather's Portraits)

programme.title: Marloch Is Metagama

programme.desc: A journey throughout Scotland to discover the history, and contemporary hand-crafted practice behind the artisan producers of woven fabrics

programme.title: Under Canvas

programme.title: Iron Women/Boireannaich Iarainn
programme.desc: The history of women's golf in Scotland. From the early pioneers of the 18th century to formidable role models who challenged the patriarchal constraints of male-dominated golfing arenas, this story celebrates the trailblazers who put Scottish women's golf firmly on the world map

programme.title: Seòid a' Chidsin - The Kitchen Coves

programme.title: Manhunt: The Raoul Moat Story
programme.desc: Ten years have passed since Newcastle bodybuilder Raoul Moat went on the run after shooting his ex-girlfriend Samantha Stobbart and her new boyfriend Chris Brown, killing the latter. Nicky Campbell presents this documentary looking back at the real-life drama as it unfolded in July 2010. Archive footage combines with interviews with family members, witnesses and journalists to piece together the tragic events that gripped the nation, and only ending when Moat shot himself dead while surrounded by armed police

programme.title: Dickinson's Biggest and Best Deals
programme.desc: David Dickinson delves into the archives to share more of his favourite moments from Real Deal, featuring a massive diamond ring that gave everyone something to talk about

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Three pairs of contestants - Di and Andy, Deborah and Hong, and Doug and Maria - call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words. Using their powers of deduction, they must correctly and quickly work out the words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show, potentially doubling their winnings or leaving with nothing. Hosted by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Andrea, Val, Nabeel and Meng pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Charity and Mackenzie are arrested. Nicky's plan backfires. Bernice is crushed

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ryan sees his facial injuries for the first time, Stu receives news of a windfall, Faye and Beth both arrange to meet an ex in secret, and Evelyn learns of Roy's health concerns

programme.title: Manhunt: The Raoul Moat Story
programme.desc: Ten years have passed since Newcastle bodybuilder Raoul Moat went on the run after shooting his ex-girlfriend Samantha Stobbart and her new boyfriend Chris Brown, killing the latter. Nicky Campbell presents this documentary looking back at the real-life drama as it unfolded in July 2010. Archive footage combines with interviews with family members, witnesses and journalists to piece together the tragic events that gripped the nation, and only ending when Moat shot himself dead while surrounded by armed police

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. Staff at the airport deal with one of the UK's worst winter storms, with winds raging out on the airfield. Meanwhile, rookie passenger experience manager Lee finds himself dealing with his first emergency fire

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Middlesbrough v Hull City, Blackburn Rovers v Coventry City and Reading v Luton Town in the Championship

programme.title: Shop: Ideal World
programme.desc: A selection of Ideal World repeat shows

programme.title: Bling
programme.desc: Gok Wan meets Tammy, who wants to create a memorial pendant, with Nikki helping turn Tammy's dreams into reality. David fixes a much-loved and worn bracelet so it's fit for a wedding day, and Mr Freeze sets one customer up for a fabulous cocktail hour. Plus, on the Buy counter, Lydia encourages a mum of four who's always helping others to treat herself to a bit of bling

Evidence leads to Professor George Gillan, a linguistic anthropologist who lives in a rambling mansion with his eccentric mother, whose 100th birthday is days away. Dodds is sure that the house has something to do with the murder, but in uncovering its history, Dodds also unearths secrets in his own past. Rose's father Shrimpie (guest star Peter Egan) is also back on the estate - with shocking news

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's sister returns home with her new fiance in tow, but their arrival coincides with a series of jewel thefts in the village. Greengrass makes a splash in the decorating business, while Mike and Bellamy throw a lively party. Bill Maynard and Jason Durr star

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The murder of a babysitter throws up a number of questions for Lewis and Hathaway - was she the intended victim or was the killer targeting her employers? Was the crime calculated or opportunistic? And why was she elaborately tied up after being murdered? As the detectives dig for clues, they are led into a world of suburban swinging and fetish photography, far removed from the Oxford they know. Gary Kemp (The Krays), Lucy Cohu (The Awakening), Ciaran McMenamin (Primeval) and Georgia Taylor (Casualty) guest star

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The Cornish copper looks to the future following an attempt on his life, and while he weighs up his options, DCI Lane resolves to pursue her lofty ambitions. Meanwhile, DI Kersey investigates a salmon poacher's suspicious death. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Jimmy Yuill and Helen Masters

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A prostitute's client confesses to the murder of another working girl before vanishing into the night, leaving Wycliffe with the tricky task of tracking him down before he kills again. Detective drama, starring Jack Shepherd

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Evan and Olivia run away, forcing Sarah to search for them alone while Danny and Du Plessis go looking for a half-drugged lioness. While tracking the animal, they crash the truck - putting the warden in need of an emergency operation. Stephen Tompkinson and Amanda Holden star

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: A string of unfortunate misunderstandings at the rival reserve convinces Rosie her stepmother is having an affair. programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back to some of their favourite properties from the show and offers tips and tricks to help viewers make the best of their homes. As well as catching up with some of the families that previously featured, Kirstie and Phil focus on the layout issues and dilemmas that many of us now face in a very different world. In this episode, the pair focus the best ways to make a budget stretch, as two families with grand renovation plans look to make their money go a long way

Now proudly pansexual and living as a woman, Sarah can't wait to road test her new body and hopes her first date as a woman will be everything she has dreamed of. programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George discovers some of the UK's most impressive historic homes, as he is granted special access to some of these extraordinary places, delving into the hidden recesses that visitors don't normally get to see. In this first episode, George's journey begins in Dorset at the UK's most exquisite example of Italianate architecture - the magnificent 17th-century Kingston Lacy. He uncovers a tale of shame and scandal on the south coast, and the beautiful Cotswold landmark - Hidcote Manor Gardens - in full bloom takes his breath away. George also mines the history of the country's last cave dwellers at one of Britain's best-kept secrets, the Rock Houses at Kinver Edge, and finally, with his husky Loki, takes a walk at spectacular Studland Bay, part of the Jurassic Coast World Heritage Site
